AI-powered web content extraction, searc: AI-powered web content extraction, search, and classification
\nYou can get your API key from [Jina AI: You can get your API key from [Jina AI](https://jina.ai).
Convert a URL into clean, LLM-friendly M: Convert a URL into clean, LLM-friendly Markdown using the Reader API.
Perform a web search and retrieve summar: Perform a web search and retrieve summarized results using the Reader API.
Answer complex questions through iterati: Answer complex questions through iterative search, reading, and reasoning with the DeepSearch API.
Assign categories to text or images usin: Assign categories to text or images using the Classifier API (zero-shot/few-shot).
Fine-tune a classifier with labeled exam: Fine-tune a classifier with labeled examples for domain-specific tasks.
The URL of the webpage to extract conten: The URL of the webpage to extract content from.
Format of the extracted content - how th: Format of the extracted content - how the webpage should be returned.
Remove all images from the response.
Create a \"Buttons & Links\" section at: Create a "Buttons & Links" section at the end to help downstream LLMs or web agents navigate the page.
Create an \"Images\" section at the end,: Create an "Images" section at the end, giving downstream LLMs an overview of all visuals on the page.
When enabled, the requested URL won't be: When enabled, the requested URL won't be cached and tracked on our server.
Processes content from all embedded ifra: Processes content from all embedded iframes in the DOM tree.
Extracts content from all Shadow DOM roo: Extracts content from all Shadow DOM roots in the document.
Choose whether to resolve to the final d: Choose whether to resolve to the final destination URL after following all redirects. Enable to follow the full redirect chain.
All infrastructure and data processing o: All infrastructure and data processing operations reside entirely within EU jurisdiction.
Return response in JSON format containin: Return response in JSON format containing URL, title, content, and timestamp (if available).
Maximum page load wait time in seconds (: Maximum page load wait time in seconds (0 means use default timeout, set a value if the default browser engine is too slow on simple webpages).
List of CSS selectors to target specific: List of CSS selectors to target specific page elements (e.g., "body, .main-content, #article").
CSS selectors to wait for before returni: CSS selectors to wait for before returning results (e.g., "#dynamic-content, .lazy-loaded").
CSS selectors for elements to remove fro: CSS selectors for elements to remove from the results (e.g., "header, footer, .ads, #sidebar").
Visit every URL in the search result and: Visit every URL in the search result and return the full content using Reader. Toggle on to enable more Reader-specific options.
The response will be in JSON format, con: The response will be in JSON format, containing the URL, title, content, and timestamp (if available). In Search mode, it returns a list of five entries, each following the described JSON structure.
This will fetch the favicon of each URL: This will fetch the favicon of each URL in the SERP and include them in the response as image URI, useful for UI rendering.
The country to use for the search. It's: The country to use for the search. It's a two-letter country code.
From where you want the search query to: From where you want the search query to originate. It is recommended to specify location at the city level in order to simulate a real user's search.
The language to use for the search. It's: The language to use for the search. It's a two-letter language code.
The result offset. It skips the given nu: The result offset. It skips the given number of results. It's used for pagination.
Returns the search results only from the: Returns the search results only from the specified website or domain. By default it searches the entire web.
Our API caches URL contents for a certai: Our API caches URL contents for a certain amount of time. Set it to true to ignore the cached result and fetch the content from the URL directly.
Constrains effort on reasoning for reaso: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.
This determines the maximum number of to: This determines the maximum number of tokens allowed for DeepSearch process. Larger budgets can improve response quality by enabling more exhaustive search for complex queries.
The maximum number of retries for solvin: The maximum number of retries for solving a problem in DeepSearch process. A larger value allows DeepSearch to retry solving the problem by using different reasoning approaches and strategies.
Forces the model to take further thinkin: Forces the model to take further thinking/search steps even when the query seems trivial. Useful if you're using DeepSearch in scenarios where you're certain the query always needs DeepSearch, rather than for trivial questions.
The maximum number of URLs to include in: The maximum number of URLs to include in the final answer/chunk. URLs are sorted by relevance and other important factors.
JSON schema for structured output format: JSON schema for structured output format. Example: { "type": "json_schema", "json_schema": { "type": "object", "properties": { "numerical_answer_only": { "type": "number" } } } }
A list of domains that are given a highe: A list of domains that are given a higher priority for content retrieval. Useful for domain-specific, high-quality sources that provide valuable content.
A list of domains to be strictly exclude: A list of domains to be strictly excluded from content retrieval. Typically used to filter out known spam, low-quality, or irrelevant websites.
A list of domains to be exclusively incl: A list of domains to be exclusively included in content retrieval. All other domains will be ignored. Useful for domain-specific searches.
The model to use for classification.
Text or image URL to classify. URLs will: Text or image URL to classify. URLs will be treated as images, other strings as text.
The labels to classify the content into.
The base model to use for training.
Number of training iterations to perform: Number of training iterations to perform.
Dedup - List unique links at the end: Dedup - List unique links at the end
All - List all links at the end: All - List all links at the end
Dedup - List unique images at the end: Dedup - List unique images at the end
All - List all images at the end: All - List all images at the end
jina-clip-v2 - Multilingual multimodal e: jina-clip-v2 - Multilingual multimodal embeddings for texts and images
jina-embeddings-v3 - Frontier multilingu: jina-embeddings-v3 - Frontier multilingual embedding model with SOTA performance
jina-clip-v1 - Multimodal embedding mode: jina-clip-v1 - Multimodal embedding models for images and English text
